articles.headline: 2026 NFL draft: Ranking top five prospects at every position
articles.description: Matt Miller and Jordan Reid stack their early top-fives at every position and break down the players they'll be watching during the 2025 season.

articles.headline: Oregon lands No. 1 safety Washington, nephew of Kobe Bryant
articles.description: Four-star prospect Jett Washington, ESPN's No. 1 safety in the 2026 class, announced his commitment to Oregon over Alabama and USC on Thursday night.

articles.headline: Brandon Arrington, No. 1 athlete prospect in 2026, picks Texas A&M
articles.description: Brandon Arrington, the No. 1 athlete prospect and 14th overall recruit in the 2026 ESPN 300, has committed to Texas A&M.

articles.headline: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
articles.description: There are 21 five-stars in the Class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

images.name: Chris Henry Jr. [608x342]
images.caption: Chris Henry Jr. committed to Ohio State in July of 2023.

images.name: Keenyi Pepe [800x800]
images.caption: Keenyi Pepe adds another impressive building block to USC's OL class.

articles.byline: Craig Haubert, Eli Lederman and Tom Luginbill

articles.headline: College football recruiting intel: Elite 11 Finals and June's final official visit weekend
articles.description: What we're hearing about one of the most important weekends on the recruiting calendar.

images.name: Landon Duckworth [608x342]
images.caption: Landon Duckworth is one of the top remaining undecided quarterbacks in the Class of 2026.

images.name: Lincoln Riley [608x342]
images.caption: Lincoln Riley's Trojans have the country's deepest recruiting class.

articles.headline: CFP leaders say 'everything's on the table' after meetings wrap
articles.description: CFP executive director Rich Clark said "pretty much everything's on the table" for potential formats for 2026 and beyond but that the group would like to make a decision by the fall.

images.name: Heather Dinich breaks down likelihood of 5+11 CFP format
images.caption: Heather Dinich joins Paul Finebaum to discuss conferences debating whether five automatic bids and 11 at-large ones for 16-team playoff is the future of CFP.

article.headline: Adams helps Southern Miss hold on to beat Troy 47-42
article.description: Jaylond Adams returned a kickoff 100 yards to help Southern Mississippi thwart Troy's come-back bid and secure a 47-42 victory on Saturday.
article.linkText: Adams helps Southern Miss hold on to beat Troy 47-42

images.name: Southern Miss, Troy score TDs on three straight plays
images.caption: After Southern Miss scores a passing touchdown, Troy returns the ensuing kickoff for a touchdown. On the very next kickoff, Southern Miss scores another touchdown to mark three consecutive touchdowns.

video.headline: Southern Miss, Troy score TDs on three straight plays
video.caption: After Southern Miss scores a passing touchdown, Troy returns the ensuing kickoff for a touchdown. On the very next kickoff, Southern Miss scores another touchdown to mark three consecutive touchdowns.
video.title: Southern Miss, Troy score TDs on three straight plays
video.description: After Southern Miss scores a passing touchdown, Troy returns the ensuing kickoff for a touchdown. On the very next kickoff, Southern Miss scores another touchdown to mark three consecutive touchdowns.

tracking.trackingName: NCF_One-Play (Southern Miss, Troy score TDs on three straight plays) 2019/9/15 ESHEET SC

article.story: TROY, Ala. -- Jaylond Adams returned a kickoff 100 yards to help Southern Mississippi thwart Troy's come-back bid and secure a 47-42 victory on Saturday. Troy's Reggie Todd had just returned a kickoff 69 yards as the Trojans closed to 33-28 with 11:28 remaining in the fourth quarter. Adams answered on the following kickoff to stretch the lead to 40-28. The teams then traded touchdowns until Troy's Kaleb Barker hit Khalil McClain on a 35-yard touchdown toss to close to 47-42 with 2:51 remaining. The ensuing onside kick was recovered by the Golden Eagles and they ran out the clock. The teams had played nine times previously but had never faced off in Troy and Southern Mississippi made the most of the opportunity, going ahead 33-21 after Neil McLaurin nailed Jordan Mitchell on a 51-yard scoring strike early in the fourth. Adams accounted for 322 all-purpose yards, catching 11 passes for 180 yards and returning three kickoffs for 136 yards total. He also had a punt return for five yards and one rush for one yard. Jack Abraham led the Golden Eagles (2-1), throwing for a career-best 463 yards and two scores. Quez Watkins finished with 209 yards receiving. Barker threw for a career-high 504 yards and four touchdowns for Troy (1-1).

videos.headline: Southern Miss' Adams returns kickoff 100 yards for TD
videos.description: Jaylond Adams goes 100 yards down the sidelines for a Southern Mississippi touchdown.

tracking.trackingName: NCF One-Play (Southern Miss' Adams returns kickoff 100 yards for TD) 2019/9/14
